# My PhD thesis

## Download

[thesis.pdf](https://github.com/wspr/thesis/raw/master/thesis.pdf)

## Information

During my PhD I experimented with the idea of writing my thesis in a public code repository.
I hoped that by making my work on my thesis public, my time would become more accountable by the fact that anyone would be able to see when I was or was not working. 
This didn't really work out as planned, but the PhD was completed eventually.

I also believe that all academic research should be made more open.
This is a small step towards such a philosophy.
(Making my code itself available would be better again, but one step at a time. The bulk of my magnetic force code is indeed [available here](http://wspr.io/magcode).)

In the [Github repository](http://www.github.com/wspr/thesis) for this work I've started to list open [issues](http://www.github.com/wspr/thesis/issues) that I'm aware of, such as typos and (gasp) mistakes.
